verse_content.Sanskrit:
त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं
त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।
त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता
सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ॥ १८ ॥
verse_content.Transliteration:
tvam akşaram paramam veditavyam
tvam asya viśvasya param nidhānam
tvam avyayaḥ śāśvata-dharma-goptā
sanātanas tvam puruṣo mato me
verse_content.Word_by_word: tvam—You; akşaram—inexhaustible; paramam—supreme; veditavyam—to be understood; tvam—You; asya—of this; viśvasya—of the universe; param—supreme; nidhānam—basis; tvam—You are; avyayah—inexhaustible; śāśvata-dharma-goptā—maintainer of the eternal religion; sanātanah—eternal; tvam—You; puruṣah—Supreme Personality; matah me—is my opinion.
verse_content.Translation: You are the supreme primal objective; You are the best in all the universes; You are inexhaustible, and You are the oldest; You are the maintainer of religion, the eternal Personality of Godhead.
